intro: Coccoloba crescentiifolia, commonly known as the Crescent-leaf coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in moist, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, waxy, and often brightly colored leaves that are typically crescent-shaped. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Coccoloba crescentiifolia is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
